identified-content.classifier: Health Maintenance Organizations and Managed Care

abstract.p: Dr Tim Lachman letter on June 30 article holds market-driven medical care is not way to provide for population's health needs; urges extending Medicare to all citizens

block.p: The decision of major health maintenance organizations to abandon more than 700,000 subscribers is a symptom that reflects a sick health care system (news article, June 30). Leaving an unprofitable market may be a sound business practice, but leaving elderly patients in turmoil to find medical insurance and new doctors is both ethically unconscionable and dangerous because it causes disruption in the continuity of care.

The decision of major health maintenance organizations to abandon more than 700,000 subscribers is a symptom that reflects a sick health care system (news article, June 30). Leaving an unprofitable market may be a sound business practice, but leaving elderly patients in turmoil to find medical insurance and new doctors is both ethically unconscionable and dangerous because it causes disruption in the continuity of care.
Market-driven medical care is not the way to provide for the health needs of our population. A rational solution is to extend Medicare to cover our entire citizenry.
TIM LACHMAN, M.D. Wynnewood, Pa., June 30, 2000
The writer is a chairman of the Philadelphia Ad Hoc Committee to Defend Health Care.
